estimated_calories.notes: Calories can vary based on wine type (e.g., red, white, dessert).

macronutrient_breakdown.notes: Wine is not a significant source of macronutrients.

present: Antioxidants (e.g., resveratrol in red wine, flavonoids)
key_vitamins_and_minerals.notes: Wine contains minimal vitamins/minerals but may offer bioactive compounds.

potential_benefits: Antioxidants in red wine may support heart health (in moderation).
Low-calorie alternative to sugary cocktails (if consumed in moderation).
health_benefits.notes: Benefits are dose-dependent and may not outweigh risks for certain individuals.

allergens: Sulfites (common in wine, may trigger allergies/asthma).
Histamines (higher in red wine, may cause reactions in sensitive individuals).
other_concerns: Alcohol content (not suitable for children, pregnant individuals, or those avoiding alcohol).
High intake linked to liver disease, addiction, and other health risks.

healthier_recommendations: Choose dry wines (lower sugar content) over sweet/dessert wines.
Limit to 1 serving (5 oz) per day for women, 2 for men (per USDA guidelines).
Pair with water to reduce overall alcohol consumption.
Avoid if managing conditions like diabetes, liver disease, or alcohol dependency.
Opt for antioxidant-rich foods (e.g., berries, nuts) instead of relying on wine for benefits.
